sen.j: 宇田川 榕菴（うだがわ ようあん、1798年3月9日（寛政10年1月22日 (旧暦)） - 1846年6月22日（弘化3年5月29日 (旧暦)））は江戸時代後期の日本の蘭学者。
sen.e: Yoan UDAGAWA (March 9, 1798 - June 22, 1846) was a Japanese Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) during the late Edo Period.
Yoan UDAGAWA (March 9, 1798 - June 22, 1846) was a Japanese Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) during the late Edo Period.
Yoan UDAGAWA (March 9, 1798 - June 22, 1846) was a Japanese Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) during the late Edo Period.

sen.j: 名は榕、緑舫とも号した。
sen.e: His name was Yo and also named him 緑舫.
His name was Yo and also named him 緑舫.
His name was Yo and also named him 緑舫.

sen.j: 宇田川榕庵とも表記される。
sen.e: His name is also written as "宇田川榕庵", Yoan UDAGAWA, (different kanji writing, same reading).
sen.cmt: 表記に関する内容のため、"宇田川榕庵"を漢字のまま残しました。
sen.e: His name is also written as "宇田川榕庵", Yoan UDAGAWA, (different kanji writing, same reading).
His name is also written as "宇田川榕庵", Yoan UDAGAWA, (different kanji writing, same reading).
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 大垣藩医江沢養樹の長男として生まれ、1811年に津山藩医宇田川玄真の養子となった。
sen.e: He was born the first son of Yoju EZAWA who was a doctor of Ogaki Domain and was adopted by Genshin UDAGAWA who was a doctor of Tsuyama Domain in 1811.
He was born the first son of Yoju EZAWA who was a doctor of Ogaki Domain and was adopted by Genshin UDAGAWA who was a doctor of Tsuyama Domain in 1811.
He was born the first son of Yoju EZAWA who was a doctor of Ogaki Domain and was adopted by Genshin UDAGAWA who was a doctor of Tsuyama Domain in 1811.

sen.j: 1817年に津山藩医となった後、1826年には幕府の天文方蕃書和解御用の翻訳員となってショメール百科事典の翻訳書『厚生新編』（こうせいしんぺん）の作成に従事するため江戸に移った。
sen.e: After he became a doctor of Tsuyama Domain in 1817, he became a translator for Bansho-wage Goyo (Government Office for Translation of Barbarian Books) in Shogunate Tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy) in 1826, and moved to Edo to make "Kosei Shinpen" which was a translation book of Chomel's Encyclopedia.
sen.cmt: 天文方→Tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy)蕃書和解御用→Bansho-wage Goyo (Government Office for Translation of Barbarian Books) 定訳不明他に、(the Translation Bureau→http://etd.library.pitt.edu/ETD/available/etd-12082004-214034/unrestricted/jmhbanshoMA.pdf#search='Tokyo university bansho wage')(the Western Books Translation Agency→ http://wpedia.goo.ne.jp/enwiki/Todai#cite_note-5)等の訳あり。ショメール→(M．Noel) Chomelhttp://www.wul.waseda.ac.jp/kosho/bunko08/b08_a0010/index.html厚生新編→Kosei Shinpen
sen.e: After he became a doctor of Tsuyama Domain in 1817, he became a translator for Bansho-wage Goyo (Government Office for Translation of Barbarian Books) in Shogunate Tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy) in 1826, and moved to Edo to make "Kosei Shinpen" which was a translation book of Chomel's Encyclopedia.

After he became a doctor of Tsuyama Domain in 1817, he became a translator for Bansho-wage Goyo (Government Office for Translation of Barbarian Books) in Shogunate Tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy) in 1826, and moved to Edo to make "Kosei Shinpen" which was a translation book of Chomel's Encyclopedia.

sen.j: 養父である宇田川玄真、またその養父である宇田川玄随、養子である宇田川興斎も蘭学者、洋学者として知られている。
sen.e: Genshin UDAGAWA who was Yoan's adopted father, Genzui UDAGAWA who was Genshin's adopted father, and Kosai UDAGAWA who was Yoan's adopted son are known as a Rangakusha and a scholar of Western Studies.
sen.cmt: 宇田川玄随→Genzui UDAGAWA宇田川興斎→Kosai UDAGAWA養父→adopted father
sen.e: Genshin UDAGAWA who was Yoan's adopted father, Genzui UDAGAWA who was Genshin's adopted father, and Kosai UDAGAWA who was Yoan's adopted son are known as a Rangakusha and a scholar of Western Studies.

Genshin UDAGAWA who was Yoan's adopted father, Genzui UDAGAWA who was Genshin's adopted father, and Kosai UDAGAWA who was Yoan's adopted son are known as a Rangakusha and a scholar of Western Studies.

sen.j: フィリップ・フランツ・フォン・シーボルトとも親交があった。
sen.e: He had a close friendship with Philipp Franz von Siebold.
He had a close friendship with Philipp Franz von Siebold.
He had a close friendship with Philipp Franz von Siebold.

sen.j: 養父との共著で1822年から1825年にかけて『遠西医方名物考』（えんせいいほうめいぶつこう）、1828年から1830年にかけて『新訂増補和蘭薬鏡』（しんていぞうほおらんだやくきょう）、1834年ごろに『遠西医方名物考補遺』といった薬学書を出版している。
sen.e: He published pharmaceutical books such as "Ensei Iho Meibutsuko" (Introduction to Western Medicines) in collaboration with his adopted father from 1822 to 1825, "Shintei Zoho Oranda Yakukyo" (Introduction to Pharmaceutical Botany) from 1828 to 1830, and "Ensei Iho Meibutsuko Hoi" (Introduction to Western Medicines, Expanded Edition) around 1834.
sen.cmt: 『遠西医方名物考』→"Ensei Iho Meibutsuko" (Introduction to Western Medicines)http://www.i-apple.jp/ensei/『新訂増補和蘭薬鏡』→"Shintei Zoho Oranda Yakukyo"(Introduction to Pharmaceutical Botany)『遠西医方名物考補遺』→"Ensei Iho Meibutsuko Hoi" (Introduction to Western Medicines, Expanded Edition)http://www.wul.waseda.ac.jp/kotenseki/html/ya09/ya09_00857_0037/index.html いずれも定訳不明薬学書→pharmaceutical book
sen.e: He published pharmaceutical books such as "Ensei Iho Meibutsuko" (Introduction to Western Medicines) in collaboration with his adopted father from 1822 to 1825, "Shintei Zoho Oranda Yakukyo" (Introduction to Pharmaceutical Botany) from 1828 to 1830, and "Ensei Iho Meibutsuko Hoi" (Introduction to Western Medicines, Expanded Edition) around 1834.

He published pharmaceutical books such as "Ensei Iho Meibutsuko" (Introduction to Western Medicines) in collaboration with his adopted father from 1822 to 1825, "Shintei Zoho Oranda Yakukyo" (Introduction to Pharmaceutical Botany) from 1828 to 1830, and "Ensei Iho Meibutsuko Hoi" (Introduction to Western Medicines, Expanded Edition) around 1834.

sen.j: 1822年（文政5年）『菩多尼訶経』（ぼたにかきょう）、1835年（天保6年）に『理学入門 植学啓原』（りがくにゅうもん そくがくけいげん）を出版して西洋の植物学を日本にはじめて紹介した。
sen.e: He published "Botanikakyo" (Introduction to Botany, Sutra-style) in 1822 and "Rigaku Nyumon Sokugaku Keigen" (Introduction to Science and Botany) in 1835, and introduced Japan to Western botanical studies for the first time.
sen.cmt: 『菩多尼訶経』→"Botanikakyo"(Introduction to Botany, Sutra-style)『理学入門 植学啓原』→"Rigaku Nyumon Sokugaku Keigen" (Introduction to Science and Botany)いずれも定訳不明植物学→Western botanical studies
sen.e: He published "Botanikakyo" (Introduction to Botany, Sutra-style) in 1822 and "Rigaku Nyumon Sokugaku Keigen" (Introduction to Science and Botany) in 1835, and introduced Japan to Western botanical studies for the first time.

He published "Botanikakyo" (Introduction to Botany, Sutra-style) in 1822 and "Rigaku Nyumon Sokugaku Keigen" (Introduction to Science and Botany) in 1835, and introduced Japan to Western botanical studies for the first time.

sen.j: 菩多尼訶は植物学を意味するラテン語Botanica の翻字であり、経はその本文を経文になぞらえて執筆したことによる。
sen.e: "菩多尼訶" (botanica) is a transcription of Latin "Botanica" meaning botany and he wrote the book to the Sutra-style following the Buddhist scriptures.
sen.cmt: 表記に関する内容のため、"菩多尼訶"を漢字のまま残しました。翻字→transcription経→sutra経典→Buddhist scriptures日本語本文内に抜けている個所があったので、ウェブの記事から抜き出し原文、訳文ともに付け加えています。（ラテン語 の翻字）→ラテン語Botanica の翻字
sen.e: "菩多尼訶" (botanica) is a transcription of Latin "Botanica" meaning botany and he wrote the book in the Sutra-style following the Buddhist scriptures.
"菩多尼訶" (botanica) is a transcription of Latin "Botanica" meaning botany and he wrote the book in the Sutra-style following the Buddhist scriptures.

sen.j: また、1837年（天保8年）から死後の1847年（弘化4年）にかけて日本ではじめての近代化学を紹介する書となる『舎密開宗』(せいみかいそう）を出版した。
sen.e: In addition, he published "Seimi Kaiso" (Elements of Experimental Chemistry) which introduced a modern chemistry for the first time in Japan from 1837 to 1847 that he already died.
sen.cmt: 近代化学→modern chemistry『舎密開宗』→"Seimi Kaiso" (Elements of Experimental Chemistry)
sen.e: In addition, he published "Seimi Kaiso" (Elements of Experimental Chemistry) which introduced modern chemistry for the first time in Japan from 1837 to 1847 after he had already died.
In addition, he published "Seimi Kaiso" (Elements of Experimental Chemistry) which introduced modern chemistry for the first time in Japan from 1837 to 1847 after he had already died.

sen.j: 舎密は化学を意味するオランダ語Chemie の字訳である。
sen.e: "Seimi" is a transliteration from Dutch "Chemie" which means chemistry.
sen.cmt: 字訳→transliteration日本語本文内に抜けている個所があったので、ウェブの記事から抜き出し原文、訳文ともに付け加えています。（オランダ語 の字訳）→オランダ語Chemie の字訳
sen.e: "Seimi" is a transliteration from Dutch "Chemie" which means chemistry.
"Seimi" is a transliteration from Dutch "Chemie" which means chemistry.

sen.j: 舎密開宗の原著はイギリスの化学者ウィリアム・ヘンリー (化学者)が1799年に出版した『Elements of Experimental Chemistry』をJ・B・トロムスドルフ（deJohann Bartholomäus Trommsdorff）がドイツ語に翻訳、増補した 『Chemie für Dilettanten』 を、さらにオランダの Adolf Ijpeij がオランダ語に翻訳、増補した『Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803』 （『依氏舎密』）である。
sen.e: "Elements of Experimental Chemistry" was published in 1799 by William Henry who was the British and chemist, "Chemie für Dilettanten" was a German translated and augmented version by Johann Bartholomäus Trommsdorff, and "Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803" was a Dutch translated and augmented version by the Dutch, Adolf Ijpeij, and the original book of "Seimi Kaiso" was "Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803" ("Ishi Seimi").
sen.cmt: ウィリアム・ヘンリー→William Henry『依氏舎密』→"Ishi Seimi"日本語本文内に抜けている個所があったので、ウェブの記事から抜き出し原文、訳文ともに付け加えています。出版した をJ・B・トロムスドルフ→出版した『Elements of Experimental Chemistry』をJ・B・トロムスドルフ増補した を→増補した『Chemie für Dilettanten』増補した （『依氏舎密』）である→増補した『Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803』 （『依氏舎密』）である。
sen.e: "Elements of Experimental Chemistry" was published in 1799 by William Henry who was the British and chemist, "Chemie für Dilettanten" was a German translation and augmented version by Johann Bartholomäus Trommsdorff, and "Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803" was a Dutch translation and augmented version by the Dutch, Adolf Ijpeij, and the original book of "Seimi Kaiso" was "Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803" ("Ishi Seimi").

"Elements of Experimental Chemistry" was published in 1799 by William Henry who was the British and chemist, "Chemie für Dilettanten" was a German translation and augmented version by Johann Bartholomäus Trommsdorff, and "Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803" was a Dutch translation and augmented version by the Dutch, Adolf Ijpeij, and the original book of "Seimi Kaiso" was "Leidraad der Chemie voor Beginnennde Liefhebbers, 1803" ("Ishi Seimi").

sen.j: しかし、単なる翻訳ではなく Adolf Ijpeij による 『Sijstematisch handboek der beschouwende en werkdaadig Scheikunde』 （『依氏広義』）、スモーレンブルグ（F. van Catz. Smallenburg）の『Leerboek der Scheikunde』 （『蘇氏舎密』）などの他の多くのオランダ語の化学書から新しい知見の増補や、宇田川榕菴自身が実際に実験した結果からの考察などが追記されている。
sen.e: It was not simply the translation book, however, he augmented the book with new knowledge from the Dutch chemical book such as "Sijstematisch handboek der beschouwende en werkdaadig Scheikunde" ("Ishi Kogi") by Adolf Ijpeij and "Leerboek der Scheikunde" ("Soshi Seimi") by F. van Catz. Smallenburg, and edited it with the considerations from the results of the experiment by Yoan himself.
sen.cmt: 『依氏広義』→"Ishi Kogi"『蘇氏舎密』→"Soshi Seimi"日本語本文内に抜けている個所があったので、ウェブの記事から抜き出し原文、訳文ともに付け加えています。Adolf Ijpeij による （『依氏広義』）→Adolf Ijpeij による『Sijstematisch handboek der beschouwende en werkdaadig Scheikunde』 （『依氏広義』）スモーレンブルグの （『蘇氏舎密』）→スモーレンブルグの 『Leerboek der Scheikunde』（『蘇氏舎密』）追記する→edit考察→consideration
sen.e: It was not simply the translation book, however, he augmented the book with new knowledge from the Dutch chemical book such as "Sijstematisch handboek der beschouwende en werkdaadig Scheikunde" ("Ishi Kogi") by Adolf Ijpeij and "Leerboek der Scheikunde" ("Soshi Seimi") by F. van Catz. Smallenburg, and edited it with the considerations from the results of the experiment by Yoan himself.

It was not simply the translation book, however, he augmented the book with new knowledge from the Dutch chemical book such as "Sijstematisch handboek der beschouwende en werkdaadig Scheikunde" ("Ishi Kogi") by Adolf Ijpeij and "Leerboek der Scheikunde" ("Soshi Seimi") by F. van Catz. Smallenburg, and edited it with the considerations from the results of the experiment by Yoan himself.

sen.j: 宇田川榕菴はこれらの出版に際し、日本語のまだ存在しなかった学術用語に新しい造語を作って翻訳した。
sen.e: For the publication, Yoan created new coined terms into the scientific terms which did not exist in Japan.
For the publication, Yoan created new coined terms into the scientific terms which did not exist in Japan.
For the publication, Yoan created new coined terms into the scientific terms which did not exist in Japan.

sen.j: 酸素、水素、窒素、炭素といった元素名や元素、酸化、還元、溶解、分析といった化学用語、細胞、生物の分類といった生物学用語は宇田川榕菴の造語である。
sen.e: Yoan created the coined terms such as element names; oxygen (酸素, sanso), hydrogen (水素, suiso), nitrogen (窒素, chisso), carbon (炭素, tanso), chemical terms; element (元素, genso), oxidation (酸化, sanka), reduction (還元, kangen), dissolution (溶解, yokai), analysis (分析, bunseki), and biological terms; cell (細胞, saibo), classification of organisms (生物の分類, seibutsu no bunrui).
sen.cmt: 日本語の造語そのものに関することなので、榕菴の造語である語には日本語をつけました。
sen.e: Yoan created the coined terms such as element names; oxygen (酸素, sanso), hydrogen (水素, suiso), nitrogen (窒素, chisso), carbon (炭素, tanso), chemical terms; element (元素, genso), oxidation (酸化, sanka), reduction (還元, kangen), dissolution (溶解, yokai), analysis (分析, bunseki), and biological terms; cell (細胞, saibo), classification of organisms (生物の分類, seibutsu no bunrui).

Yoan created the coined terms such as element names; oxygen (酸素, sanso), hydrogen (水素, suiso), nitrogen (窒素, chisso), carbon (炭素, tanso), chemical terms; element (元素, genso), oxidation (酸化, sanka), reduction (還元, kangen), dissolution (溶解, yokai), analysis (分析, bunseki), and biological terms; cell (細胞, saibo), classification of organisms (生物の分類, seibutsu no bunrui).

sen.j: また、自然科学分野に留まらず、オランダ語の度量衡に使用する単位についての解説『西洋度量考』やオランダの歴史、地理を解説した『和蘭志略稿』、コーヒーについての紹介『哥非乙説』（こひいせつ）なども記している。
sen.e: Moreover, he wrote not only a natural science but also "Seiyo Doryoko" which was about Western scales and measures in Dutch, "Oran Shiryakuko" which was about Dutch history and geography, and "Kohi Setsu" which introduced a coffee.
sen.cmt: 『西洋度量考』→"Seiyo Doryoko"『和蘭志略稿』→"Oran Shiryakuko"『哥非乙説』→"Kohi Setsu"
sen.e: Moreover, he wrote not only a natural science but also "Seiyo Doryoko" which was about Western scales and measures in Dutch, "Oran Shiryakuko" which was about Dutch history and geography, and "Kohi Setsu" which introduced a coffee.

Moreover, he wrote not only a natural science but also "Seiyo Doryoko" which was about Western scales and measures in Dutch, "Oran Shiryakuko" which was about Dutch history and geography, and "Kohi Setsu" which introduced a coffee.
